definition: to leave the mountain (of a hermit)/to come out of obscurity to a government job/to take a leading position

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: According to this article, the former boxing champ is going to try again.
sentences.chinese: 根據這篇文章所言，前拳王又出山了。

sentences.english: Doesn't this show that the sun is nearer to us at noon?
sentences.chinese: 這不正說明太陽出山時離我們近嗎？

sentences.english: Eventually, after the Gao Ni that learns to be become somewhat gives mountain, began old 1000 career.
sentences.chinese: 終於，學有所成的高尼出山後，開始了老千生涯。

sentences.english: Qi has been successfully developed Chushan area and the Zhuyuan and other large mature community .
sentences.chinese: 已經成功開發出山奇小區和金竹苑等大型成熟社區。

definition: (of a person) to return to the fray after a period of inactivity/to jump back into the thick of things/(of sth that was once popular) to be resurrected/to make a comeback
to go back to one's native place and live in seclusion
to ask sb to resign from a post
to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
to finish apprenticeship/to graduate/to send out troops (under a commander)
to go uphill/to spin cocoon (silkworms)/to pass away
